thread.title: Suspect sought in teen girl’s murder
thread.title_full: Suspect sought in teen girl’s murder

author: Raisa Habersham
title: Suspect sought in teen girl’s murder
text:
Atlanta police are looking for a man they say shot a 16-year-old girl outside an apartment complex in southwest Atlanta.
Dwight Lewis is accused of killing Keosha Tinch of Decatur on Thursday outside the Deerfield Gardens Apartment on the 2900 block of Campbellton Road.
According to police, Lewis pulled out a semi-automatic handgun and fired several shots at Tinch, including a fatal blow to the head.
RELATED: Teenager killed in shootout at apartment complex
Tinch was seated in the backseat an SUV that entered the gated community at the time of the shooting. Lewis allegedly began firing at the car and the there was an exchange of gunfire, Atlanta police Lt. Charles Hampton told Channel 2 Action News.
The SUV collided with three parked cars during the incident, police said.
No one else was injured in the incident.
Anyone with information is asked to contact Atlanta police. Tipsters can also remain anonymous, and be eligible for rewards of up to $2,000, by contacting Crime Stoppers Atlanta at 404-577-8477, texting information to 274637 or visiting crimestoppersatlanta.org.
